name: Hunter Hills Elementary
description: Hunter Hills Elementary School is a public elementary school serving students in Pre-K through 5th grade in the Laurel County School District. The school provides comprehensive education with a focus on relationships, resilience, and recognition. Programs include Gifted & Talented education, special education services, and free/reduced lunch programs. The school serves 603 students with a student-teacher ratio of 13.7:1.
source: Verified from official school website, NCES database, and Facebook page
eligibility_requirements: Open to all students in the Laurel County School District attendance zone
cost_information: Free public education, free/reduced lunch available for eligible students
notes: VERIFIED INFORMATION: All contact information verified on 2024-01-15. CITATIONS: Contact information verified from official school website https://www.laurel.kyschools.us/o/hhes. School hours updated to 8:10 AM-3:05 PM starting August 7th as noted on Facebook page. Enrollment data (603 students) and student-teacher ratio (13.7:1) verified from NCES database. School serves Pre-K through 5th grade with Gifted & Talented program available. All information cross-referenced with multiple sources for consistency.
